title: Rear Brake Pressure Switch - Removal

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
, ensure the union manifold is restrained by a suitable tool. Failure to do this may cause damage to the supporting bracket.
Seat and Battery - remove DD2; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4

body.body: Drain the fluid from the master cylinder by bleeding the system at the rear caliper until all fluid has been expelled.
Remove the two alternator regulator/rectifier fixings and position the regulator/rectifier to one side.
Loosen the rear brake switch bracket fixing sufficiently for access to the rear brake switch cable.
Disconnect the rear brake switch from the main harness, noting the routing of the cable for installation. Route the cable through to allow it to rotate when turning the rear brake switch.
Use a suitable tool to restrain the rear brake switch union manifold.
, release the rear brake pressure switch from the union manifold and remove from the motorcycle. Discard the two sealing washers from the brake line union.
Remove and discard the rear brake switch bracket fixing.
